text: The electoral district of Burnie was a single-member electoral district of the Tasmanian House of Assembly. It centred on the town of Burnie on Tasmania's northern coast. The seat was created in a redistribution ahead of the 1903 state election from parts of Waratah and West Devon, and was abolished when the Tasmanian parliament adopted the Hare-Clark electoral model in 1909. It had a single member during its existence, Herbert Payne. ==Members for Burnie== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Member!!Term |- | | Herbert Payne | 1903–1909 |} ==References== * * * Parliament of Tasmania (2006). The Parliament of Tasmania from 1956 Burnie
title: Electoral district of Burnie
